data.title: Reduced the Travis dependencies and adapted the installation instructions
data.body: Followup of https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/pull/6950.

data.title: JamsRadar trait should be removed
data.body:
This can now be done by making `ProvidesRadar` inherit `UpgradableTrait` and giving the radar jammer an `UpgradeActorsNear` trait that disables it.

This together with #7035 provides a self-contained testcase for thinking about how multiple upgrades should interact with a single trait.
## <bountysource-plugin>

Want to back this issue? **[Post a bounty on it!](https://www.bountysource.com/issues/6623474-jamsradar-trait-should-be-removed?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github)** We accept bounties via [Bountysource](https://www.bountysource.com/?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github).
</bountysource-plugin>

data.title: Moved several render traits from Mods.RA to Common
data.body: What the title said.

data.title: Use upgrades to untangle implicit Building trait dependencies
data.body:
A number of traits include workarounds to disable their functionality until the building make animation has completed.  These all require querying the Building trait, and many of them do it without properly accounting for the trait construct order which causes them to break if the order that the traits are specified in the yaml is changed.

We can now use @atlimit8's new upgrade/disabled trait system to replace these hardcoded hacks:
1. Introduce a new trait that implements `INotifyBuildComplete` and grants an upgrade when the construction is complete / revokes the upgrade before selling.
2. Set `UpgradeMinEnabledLevel` for the traits that should only be enabled once the construction is complete. 
## <bountysource-plugin>

Want to back this issue? **[Post a bounty on it!](https://www.bountysource.com/issues/6623218-use-upgrades-to-untangle-implicit-building-trait-dependencies?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github)** We accept bounties via [Bountysource](https://www.bountysource.com/?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github).
</bountysource-plugin>

data.title: Dog fault crashes to desktop
data.body:
I was playing openRA in a large game when I encountered an error that faulted the game to the desktop. Here is the crash exception. I can add more logs from this event if it feels useful.

```
        jon@X240 ~/.openra/Logs $ cat exception.log 
        Red Alert Mod at Version release-20141029
        Operating System: Linux (Unix 3.13.0.24)
        Runtime Versi   on: Mono 3.2.8 (Debian 3.2.8+dfsg-4ubuntu1) CLR 4.0.30319.17020
        Exception of type `System.InvalidOperationException`: Attempted to get trait from destroyed object (dog 3895 (not in world))
          at OpenRA.TraitDictionary.CheckDestroyed (OpenRA.Actor actor) [0x00000] in <filename unknown>:0 
          at OpenRA.TraitDictionary.WithInterface[ICrushable] (OpenRA.Actor actor) [0x00000] in <filename unknown>:0 
          at OpenRA.Actor.TraitsImplementing[ICrushable] () [0x00000] in <filename unknown>:0 
          at OpenRA.Mods.RA.Move.MobileInfo+<GetAvailableSubCell>c__AnonStorey1.<>m__0 (OpenRA.Actor a) [0x00000] in <filename unknown>:0 
          at OpenRA.Traits.ActorMap.AnyUnitsAt (CPos a, SubCell sub, System.Func`2 withCondition) [0x00000] in <filename unknown>:0 
          at OpenRA.Traits.ActorMap.FreeSubCell (CPos a, SubCell preferredSubCell, System.Func`2 checkIfBlocker) [0x00000] in <filename unknown>:0 
          at OpenRA.Mods.RA.Move.MobileInfo.GetAvailableSubCell (OpenRA.World world, OpenRA.Actor self, CPos cell, SubCell preferredSubCell, OpenRA.Actor ignoreActor, CellConditions check) [0x00000] in <filename unknown>:0 
          at OpenRA.Mods.RA.Move.Mobile.GetAvailableSubCell (CPos a, SubCell preferredSubCell, OpenRA.Actor ignoreActor, Boolean checkTransientActors) [0x00000] in <filename unknown>:0 
          at OpenRA.Mods.RA.Move.Move.PopPath (OpenRA.Actor self, OpenRA.Mods.RA.Move.Mobile mobile) [0x00000] in <filename unknown>:0 
          at OpenRA.Mods.RA.Move.Move+MoveFirstHalf.OnComplete (OpenRA.Actor self, OpenRA.Mods.RA.Move.Mobile mobile, OpenRA.Mods.RA.Move.Move parent) [0x00000] in <filename unknown>:0 
          at OpenRA.Mods.RA.Move.Move+MovePart.InnerTick (OpenRA.Actor self, OpenRA.Mods.RA.Move.Mobile mobile) [0x00000] in <filename unknown>:0 
          at OpenRA.Mods.RA.Move.Move+MovePart.Tick (OpenRA.Actor self) [0x00000] in <filename unknown>:0 
          at OpenRA.Traits.Util.RunActivity (OpenRA.Actor self, OpenRA.Traits.Activity act) [0x00000] in <filename unknown>:0 
          at OpenRA.Mods.RA.Activities.MoveAdjacentTo.Tick (OpenRA.Actor self) [0x00000] in <filename unknown>:0 
          at OpenRA.Traits.Util.RunActivity (OpenRA.Actor self, OpenRA.Traits.Activity act) [0x00000] in <filename unknown>:0 
          at OpenRA.Actor.Tick () [0x00000] in <filename unknown>:0 
          at OpenRA.World.Tick () [0x00000] in <filename unknown>:0 
          at OpenRA.Game.InnerLogicTick (OpenRA.Network.OrderManager orderManager) [0x00000] in <filename unknown>:0 
          at OpenRA.Game.LogicTick () [0x00000] in <filename unknown>:0 
          at OpenRA.Game.Loop () [0x00000] in <filename unknown>:0 
          at OpenRA.Game.Run () [0x00000] in <filename unknown>:0 
          at OpenRA.Program.Run (System.String[] args) [0x00000] in <filename unknown>:0 
          at OpenRA.Program.Main (System.String[] args) [0x00000] in <filename unknown>:0 
```

data.title: Tweaked spice harvester carryalls
data.body: A followup of https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/pull/6780 that fixes the remaining quirks I had.

data.title: Change some Exts.MakeArray calls into Enumerable.Range.
data.body: Avoid creating some arrays where sequences will suffice.

data.title: Ability to zoom in and out in Spectate and Replay view
data.body: Ability to zoom in and out just like in the OpenRA Editor while in Spectator mode and when watching Replays.

data.title: Object <OpenRA.Mods.RA.UpgradeActorsNear> revoked more levels of upgrade cloakgenerator than it granted
data.body:
Got this while doing some playtesting. It was on TS, so maybe it's just some rules being dodgy, but I rather suspect there's a check missing somewhere.

```
Exception of type `System.InvalidOperationException`: Object <OpenRA.Mods.RA.UpgradeActorsNear> revoked more levels of upgrade cloakgenerator than it granted for e2 68.
  at OpenRA.Mods.Common.UpgradeManager.RevokeUpgrade (OpenRA.Actor self, System.String upgrade, System.Object source) [0x00060] in /home/oliver/devel/openra/git/OpenRA.Mods.Common/Upgrades/UpgradeManager.cs:125 
  at OpenRA.Mods.RA.UpgradeActorsNear.ActorExited (OpenRA.Actor a) [0x00046] in /home/oliver/devel/openra/git/OpenRA.Mods.RA/UpgradeActorsNear.cs:131 
  at OpenRA.Traits.ActorMap+ProximityTrigger.Tick (OpenRA.Traits.ActorMap am) [0x000fd] in /home/oliver/devel/openra/git/OpenRA.Game/Traits/World/ActorMap.cs:146
```

Can you please take a look, @atlimit8?

data.title: Different EVA voice for each side?
data.body:
Hi guys. I'm currently developing my Tiberian Origins mod, in witch has four sides Allies, Soviet, GDI, Nod - and would like to have the Tiberian Dawn EVA voice for the CnC sides, and Red Alert voice for the RA sides. Could this be implemented?

Disambiguation - EVA voice refers to in-game "announcements"

data.title: Infantry does not de cloak while planting C4 / infiltrating
data.body: Hi guys. So I wanted to give NOD a cloakable commando in my mod (Tiberium Origins). After I coded the unit, I noticed it won't decloak before planting a C4 charge. Could you make it so if infantry has to plant C4 or infiltrate a building it has to decloak?

data.title: Planes bump helicopters out of their way
data.body:
![repulsion](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/9139965/5219186/3e0597aa-7655-11e4-9dac-a5e4fdeb2ffd.png)

related to #6087 , #6967 

it might be not a bug ... but its definitly a "unwanted unit behaviour" and balance problem        introduced through repulsion ... which is "imo" a regression (not the repulsion , but the side-effects )

data.title: afk and ranks
data.body:
ive made a animated little clock for @pchote  a couple of months ago ... but he then decided to use something different for his idea .. 

now i thought , maybe we could use it for something different then ... 

players (specially admins) being afk ... is a problem that never got discussed ... its no a "big" issue , but it exists ... so , maybe we could indicate a "idle" player in the lobby ... with an icon 
... after somewhat ~1 Minute ... it pops up ... and everyone knows "this admin/player is afk since 1 minute"

so ... in order to make place for this icon ... we could scrap the "admin crown" ... and instead ... change the color of the admins Name ... then we could save that little space ... for new icons 
looks like this : 

![afk and new admin and ranks](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/9139965/5214035/c6385a5c-7616-11e4-84a8-926e9c44eefc.png)

data.title: Control whether actor is poisioned by resource through the use of upgrades.
Check shroud against the support power's owner when teleporting
data.body:
...instead of the teleported unit's.

Thanks to @Phrohdoh and Moirae on IRC for the grunt work.

Fixes #6999.

data.title: Slight cursor lag
data.body:
I have a slight cursor lag when playing OpenRA, no matter what resolution setting I choose(pseudo-fullscreen/fullscreen/windowed) or whether the FPS limiter is enabled.

It seems that it's because V-Sync is forced at the moment. While I still had V-Sync on 'automatic' in my video card settings, the cursor did indeed have a latency. But now that I have forced V-Sync off in my video card settings, the latency is gone.

Have had this issue with a few other games while V-Sync was on, so it would be nice to be given the option, for those who don't want/know how/can't force V-Sync off.

data.title: Dynamic Game Speed
data.body: This is often requested in social media comments. People usually underestimate the effort. It is not simply done by adding a slider to the GUI, but adapt the whole engine and make sure it does not introduce choppiness or desyncs.

data.title: Move the core of OpenRA.Mods.RA.Scripting to OpenRA.Mods.Common.Scripting
data.body: Depends on #6750 for moving `Scripting\Properties\UpgradeProperties.cs`.

data.title: Fix ChronoshiftPower shroud checks.
data.body:
Fixed ChronoshiftPower checking the actor's owner's shroud vs the player using the power.
Closes #6999

data.title: Compressed server commands
data.body: Significant bulk of data minimized, plus an index of all the commands and added compiler safety.

data.title: Do not show cargo on radar map
data.body: Fixes #6990

data.title: Add min range to bazookas
data.body: Fixes #7000
